steps.instruction: To make your app nice and shinny, pick a background color
Open the parts tray by clicking the '+' button
Add a 'Label to your app using drag and drop'
Select the label you added by clicking on it in the part tray
You can tweak you label by clicking on the edit button
In the config panel, you can change many thing on your label. Try to make it bigger by using the 'Text size' slider
Nice, now, to make your app look nice, move the text in the middle
Now, it is time to code your app, click on the button at the top left of the screen to go back
Click on the big 'Add code' button
Choose 'When make is clicked' to add code that will run when your app starts

To change what the text says, you can use the 'set Label to' block.
 You can find the block in the 'Label' category on the top left

The block you just added need another block that tell what to write.
 Take the text block in the text section and plug it in the block you just created

The block you just added need another block that tell what to write.
 Take the text block in the text section and plug it in the block you just created
Now, you can type in the text you want to be displayed. Just to see if it works, type in your name
Let's see if your test program works, hit the 'make' button on the bottom right of the screen
Yay, we can control the text to display what we want! Next step, displaying the temperature
